title.rendered: How to Find Drafts on Facebook for PC, Android & iOS?

content.rendered:
Drafts on Facebook are a valuable feature that allows users to save their unfinished posts and return to them later. Whether it’s a text post, a photo, or a video, these drafts give users the flexibility and convenience to work on their content at their own pace. In this article, we will explore what drafts are on Facebook, the different types available, and the significance of finding drafts on this popular social media platform.

Drafts on Facebook are incomplete posts that users can save for later editing or publishing. They act as a virtual workspace where users can gather their thoughts, refine their content, and perfect their message before making it public.

Facebook offers various types of drafts to cater to different forms of content. Text posts are the most common draft type, allowing users to write and edit their thoughts, ideas, and announcements before sharing them with friends or followers.

In addition to text posts, Facebook allows users to save drafts of photos and videos. This feature is handy for those who want to curate their visual content carefully or enhance their images and videos with editing tools before posting them.

Finding drafts on Facebook holds significant value for users, primarily regarding convenience and efficiency. It enables individuals to work on their posts progressively, allowing them to revisit and refine their ideas whenever they wish. This flexibility is especially beneficial when dealing with time-sensitive or complex posts that require careful consideration.

Table of Contents

Toggle
  • How to Find Facebook Drafts on a PC?
  • How to Find Drafts on Facebook for Android?
    • Facebook Page:
    • Profile posts:
  • How to Find Drafts on Facebook for iOS?
    • For Facebook page:
  • How to Create Drafts on Facebook?
    • Using Publishing Tools
      • How to use publishing tools step by step?
    • Using Creator Studio
      • How to use Creator studio step by step?
  • How to Edit or Publish A Draft On Facebook?
    • Log in to your Facebook account
    • Access your drafts
    • Select the desired page
    • Navigate to the Publishing Tools section
    • Find your drafts
    • Edit your draft
    • Preview your changes
    • Publish the edited draft
  • Wrapping up!

How to Find Facebook Drafts on a PC?

You get the best experience of using Facebook drafts when you log into your account on a computer. The Facebook drafts on the desktop let you save text, photos, and videos in a single place for convenient access across all your devices. To find the drafts for Facebook Pages on a PC, follow these steps:

  • First, visit Facebook’s official website and log in to your account.
  • Next, go to Facebook’s “Pages” tab and choose the specific page to find the saved drafts.
  • Click on the drop-down to expand the Meta Business Suite option and choose Publishing tools.
  • Here, you will find the “Drafts” tab and a list of all the drafts you’ve saved.
  • Pick the desired draft that you want to edit.
  • Once you are done editing, you can either publish it or schedule the draft at any specific time.

One thing to keep in mind is that for any reason if the browser crashes, you won’t be able to retrieve drafts for profile posts.

Also, Read –

How Much Does Facebook Advertising Cost

6 Ways to Enhance Your Social Media Engagement

How to Find Drafts on Facebook for Android?

The process of finding Facebook drafts on Android is also quick and straightforward.

Facebook Page:

  • First, you will need to download the Meta Business Suite app from the Google Play Store.
  • After that, open the Facebook app and click on the hamburger menu icon.
  • Click on the Posts and Stories button.
  • Now, click on the drop-down arrow and select Drafts. Here, you will find all the listed saved drafts.
  • Pick the draft you want to edit and once you’re done, you can either publish it or schedule it.

Profile posts:

To check out drafted posts from the profile, you need to receive a notification from the platform after your post was successfully saved. You need to keep in mind that all your saved drafts will be discarded automatically after 72 hours. Thus, if you want to edit your saved drafts, you have 3 days to do it. Follow the below steps to work on your drafts on Android:

  • Go to your Facebook mobile app and visit the Notification tab and click on the notification of your saved draft.
  • Click on the back button option and here, you will see all the saved drafts.

How to Find Drafts on Facebook for iOS?

Accessing Facebook post drafts in iOS is also quick and easy. Follow the below steps of find drafts on your iOS devices.

For Facebook page:

  • First, you need to download the Meta Business Suite app on your iPhone to access the drafts.
  • Once you download it, go to your Facebook app and log into your account.
  • In the hamburger menu of Facebook, select pages. After that, go for Posts and Stories section.
  • In the drop-down, choose Drafts and you can pick your preferred one to edit it.
  • Once you edit, you can publish it or schedule it for a particular time.

Same as Android, for profile posts, you will receive a notification after you save the post. So, follow the same steps as we mentioned in Android and access your drafts. The drafts here on iOS are also discarded after 72 hours. So, you should take action on it within 3 days otherwise, you can’t retrieve your saved drafts on Facebook.

How to Create Drafts on Facebook?

By utilizing the Drafts feature, Facebook users can easily manage their content creation and ensure that their posts are polished before sharing them with their friends and followers. On this note, let’s explore how to create Drafts using different methods and devices. Even if you’ve not used the FB post drafts feature before, you’ll be a pro in no time. Let’s start with publishing tools.

Using Publishing Tools

Creators can easily access the Publishing tools on their Facebook pages. In the drop-down arrow, you’ll find the drafts section. You can create a new post and save it as a draft to review later or publish immediately. With Publishing tools, you can also manage drafts, schedule posts in advance and access insights about your post performance. Below is the step by step process of using publishing tools.

How to use publishing tools step by step?

To create a draft on Facebook using publishing tools, follow these steps:

  • Sign into your Facebook account using your credentials.
  • On the home page, navigate to the left-hand side menu and click on ‘Pages’.
  • Under the ‘Pages you manage’ section, select the desired page where you want to create a draft.
  • In the left sidebar, click on ‘Publishing tools’ (previously known as ‘Manage page’).
  • Locate the ‘Drafts’ button under the ‘Posts’ section and click on it.
  • Then, click on the ‘Create’ button at the top of the window to open the post creation window.
  • Write your text and add media if desired. Once finished, click on ‘Save as draft’ to successfully save your post as a draft.

Using Creator Studio

To help creators with their content creation, Facebook has released the Creator Studio app. With it, you can manage drafts and publish posts whenever you’re ready. You can also view insights for each post to understand how your content is performing. Whether you want to review Facebook drafts, schedule posts in advance or view insights, Creator Studio has everything you need for a successful post.

How to use Creator studio step by step?

  • Sign in to the Facebook Creator Studio using your credentials. After logging in, you will be redirected to the home page of Creator Studio.
  • Search the “Create Post” option on the top of the left sidebar. Click on the “Create Post” button from the dropdown menu to open the post creation window.
  • Within this window, you will find various post creation options, including business tools like Tag Products and Sponsors.
  • Once you have created your post, you can press the triangle icon, located beside the “Publish” button to proceed.

Please be aware that clicking the “Publish” button will immediately publish your content and it will not be saved as a draft. Therefore, it is advisable to click on “Save as Draft” if you wish to save your post in draft form and delay publishing it.

How to Edit or Publish A Draft On Facebook?

Log in to your Facebook account

First, open the Facebook website or launch the Facebook app on your device. Enter your login credentials (email/phone number and password) to access your account.

Access your drafts

On the Facebook homepage or news feed, locate the left-hand side menu and scroll down until you find the “Pages” section. Click on the “Pages” option to view your created pages.

Select the desired page

From the list of pages you manage, choose the one where you want to edit or publish a draft. Click on the page name to access its management panel.

Navigate to the Publishing Tools section

At the top of the page, locate the navigation menu and click on the “Publishing Tools” tab. This will take you to a new page that contains various tools for managing your page’s content.

Find your drafts

In the left-hand side menu of the Publishing Tools page, click on the “Drafts” option. This will display all your saved drafts for the selected page.

Edit your draft

Locate the draft you wish to edit and click on it. This will open the draft for editing in a new window. Make any necessary changes to the text, images, links, or other elements of the post.

Preview your changes

Once you’ve finished editing your draft, it’s a good idea to preview your changes before publishing. Click on the “Preview” button to see how your edited post will appear on Facebook.

Publish the edited draft

If you are satisfied with the changes made to your draft, click on the “Publish” button. This will immediately publish the edited post to your Facebook page and make it visible to your audience.

Wrapping up!

Editing and publishing drafts on Facebook is an important way to ensure your content looks its best when you share it with the world. By following the steps above, you can easily manage your drafts and publish high-quality posts to your page. Facebook drafts is a useful tool for managing content and staying organized, so make sure to use it whenever you need to make changes to your posts. Whether you’re using the desktop site or the mobile app, making edits to your drafts is easy and fast. Start taking advantage of this feature today and see how efficient you can be in creating content for your audience!
